headline: Meriton to go up in Dee Why: approval given for two 17-storey apartment towers
text:
Harry Triguboff's Meriton has received approval for a four-building mixed-used development at Dee Why on Sydney's northern beaches.

The developer also said it had completed negotiations with supermarket Woolworths to anchor the retail component of the Lighthouse development with a ground-floor tenancy covering 4000 square metres.

Meriton has presold a quarter of the 351 apartments it will build in two 17-level towers. Sales opened in November and 80 per cent of those were to people already living within 10km of the site, it said.

Nearly one-third (109) of the apartments in the residential project with an end value of $400 million have three bedrooms. There will also be an in-built childcare facility. Just under half (163) are two-bedroom apartments.
summary:
Harry Triguboff's Meriton has received approval for a four-building mixed-used development at Dee Why on Sydney's northern beaches.
Just under half (163) are two-bedroom apartments.
Meriton has presold a quarter of the 351 apartments it will build in two 17-level towers.
The developer also said it had completed negotiations with supermarket Woolworths to anchor the retail component of the Lighthouse development with a ground-floor tenancy covering 4000 square metres.
Nearly one-third (109) of the apartments in the residential project with an end value of $400 million have three bedrooms.
